location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Notebook of George Nathaniel Curzon's Travels through Persia

physicalDescription.extent: The notes proceed in approximate chronological order from the front to the rear of the volume.

Foliation: the foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the front cover with 1, and terminates at the last folio with 92; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.

mods.abstract: This volume is a bound notebook with handwritten notes and sketches in pencil by George Nathaniel Curzon. The notes mostly relate to Curzon's travels through Persia in 1889-90. The notebook begins with general notes; later folios resemble diary entries, with date headings included from folio 36 onwards. Most of the folios have a vertical line drawn down the centre in pencil or ink; these lines do not represent column divisions, as the notes are written across the lines rather than in columns.Included with the notebook is a folded piece of paper with the printed address 'Clyde House, London Road, East Grinstead.'
